basics.name: Alexandre Touret
basics.label: Senior Software Architect
basics.summary:
I am senior software architect with 22 years' experience passionate about technology, cloud and development. Throughout my career,I have designed, built and managed systems from small to large in various business contexts such as insurance, financial services or transport industries.

 I then enjoy sharing my knowledge by speaking at conferences, organizing workshops and writing articles.

work.name: Worldline Mobility & e-Transactional Services
highlights: Drove technical studies on identity management and user federation based on Redhat SSO & OpenID Connect
Supported developers on CI/CD and Openshift deployment matters
Built and shipped JAVA Spring & NodeJS based technical micro services on Openshift
Technologies:  JAVA, SPRING, DOCKER, OPENSHIFT (KUBERNETES, HELM), GITLAB, REST, PostgreSQL, REDHATSSO, Typescript, NodeJS,ARTEMIS
work.summary: Within the Mobility & e-Transactional Services, I have been involved in the new electronic ticketing system of the Ile de France region which will impact million of locals and tourists. I have been part of the technical direction, striving with mid and long term complex studies and supporting developers on technical matters.

work.name: Worldline Financial Services
highlights: Promoted best practices for developers and designers
Designed, built, shpipped and promoted GITLABCI CI/CD pipelines to increase quality across all the french acquiring department projects
Drove two PCI DSS audit sessions presenting our software quality standards
Designed, built cloud native applications on top of Openshift, Spring, Apigee and MongoDB
Designed, shipped a cloud native application (99.95%SLA, 600+ TPS) on GCP using Kubernetes
Built and promoted the department technology radar
Participated to pre sales events
Led an expert workgroup which was responsible for creating and promoting architecture patterns repository
Audited three payment applications with strong requirements (99.95%SLA, 600+ TPS,...) reporting recommendations and risk analysis
Technologies:  JAVA, SPRING (BOOT,...),JAVAEE, DOCKER, OPENSHIFT (KUBERNETES, HELM), GITLAB, REST, MONGODB, Google Cloud Platform
work.summary: Worldline is the payment industry european leader. Within the french acquiring departement, I led technically an eight development team. Besides my daily job in this Business Unit, I was strongly involved in the Expert Community. I led and drove workgroups (international context) about architecture design & spoke at international tech conferences (DevoxxUK, JNation, SnowCampIO,...).

work.name: Harmonie Mutuelle
highlights: Led, drove a SOA adoption project, managing eight stakeholders with different profiles (ops, developers, IT architects). This platform aimed to promote service reusability across the Harmonie Mutuelle IT landscape (50+ services)
Shipped TIBCO Business Works platform and build associated tooling (scripts, CI/CD, monitoring)
Designed and created SOA standards and blueprints.
Shipped TIBCO API Management platform and built the associated tooling in Python to expose internal services to customers and partners
Built a CI platform, processes and libraries based on JENKINS, SONARQUBE and SONARQUBE
Advocated on code quality, unit testing
Supported developers on JAVAEE and Spring projects
Designed a DataHub platform and built POCs against Kafka and Spark
